poem:
Title: Tucked Away in Diplomatic Shadows

In Brasília's heart,
A prominent guest cloaked by night,
Clung to diplomatic right,
While allies were cut apart.
A former leader, future feared,
In embassy walls disappeared.

His flight from legality,
Made stark in the cold light of dawn,
A mystery for the forlorn -
A game of grand fallacy.
Once high, now lie in fraught quietude,
In a foreign house of solitude.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
